title: Boolean Algebra Parser
description: Parse boolean expressions with AND/OR operators, supporting proper precedence, parentheses, and variable evaluation.

motivation.why: Boolean expressions are fundamental to search queries, conditional logic, circuit design, and formal verification. Parsing them correctly enables powerful query and rule systems.

inputFormat.description: Boolean expressions using variables (varN), AND, and OR operators. AND has higher precedence than OR. Parentheses can override precedence.
inputFormat.syntax: expression = variable | (expression) | expression AND expression | expression OR expression

examples.description: Mixed precedence: (var1 AND var2) OR var3
AND binds tighter: var1 OR (var2 AND var3)

outputFormat.description: The parser returns a BoolExpr enum representing the expression tree that can be evaluated with variable bindings.

type.description: BoolExpr enum with variants: Var(String), And(Box<BoolExpr>, Box<BoolExpr>), Or(Box<BoolExpr>, Box<BoolExpr>)

evaluation.description: Can be evaluated with HashMap<String, bool> bindings
